body.p:
Danville 8th Day of June 1865
To His Excellency
Thomas. E. Bramlett

your Petitioners W. C. Lamb George Cooley & J. L. Rollins & G. W. Glasscock wold state to your Excellency -- that they went upon the Bail Bond of Rheuben Cooley upon a charge of Larceny To answer at the Boyle Circuit at the august Term of said court 1861 -- said Cooley in a few weeks thereafter was a soldier at the time enlisted in the Federal army & made a good & faithful soldier through out his enlistmen he ^has^ been discharged -- is verry poor -- we his securities are very poor with families & our true & Loyal men to the united states government -- we have paid & satisfied the atty for the commonwealth & ask you to remit the fine
sworn & subscribed before me by W. C. Lamb this the 8th day of June 1865
Jona B. Nichols. clk B. C. C
we whose names are hereto signed believe the statements made by W. C. Lamb are true & would respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the above fine

Joshua F. Bell
B. D. Williams
J. B. Nichols clk
M T Chrisman C. B C C
Fon. T. Fox

Boyle Cir Ct
vs
W, C, Lamb & others
$200,
Forfieture
167th June/65
